Articles.Content:
*Now back * Although, this picture is slightly outdated, a new one will come.

I and Germalto are proud to present (again) the M.M.M Mod. A bunch of hollow parts designed to make bases on the surface of almost every space bodies in Kerbal Space Program! (*almost* exactly. This thing is absolutely not design for very low gravity, like Gilly. If you want to try, it's your problem, but don't complain that your kerbals tend to not stick to the floor.)

But... What is it, exactly?

Well, this pack now contains:

- [Corridor Module]: A corridor! You heard me right, a long non-regular octagonal tube that is designed to contain your Kerbals on EVA. Now with 100% more windows.

- [Central Connector Node]: A four-way node! Like the 6-ways that is already in game, but with only four ways ( ) BUT it is the size of the corridor, and you can walk through it ( )

- [Observation Module]: A big module that is the form of a hexadecagon, and that has a transparent-blueish roof, and large transparent-blueish windows (The color transparent-blueish will be patented... I hope.) This thing is brilliant, I mean, really, although I don't recommend being in it while in orbit, or without significant gravity. The interior can get really... dead-spacey.

- [Modular to 2.5m Adaptor]: The most simple part, yet the most useful. It's an adaptor that be attached to a 2.5 meter part on a side (the round one...) and to a Modular Module on the other side. Isn't it awesome?

- [Landing Legs]: They're animated, sleek, and they fit perfectly under the corridor. They act as regular landing legs, press G to deploy, or map them to an action group.

- [Airlock]: An airlock that opens and closes. Can be opened in EVA and in regular view. Warning: This airlock isn't airtight when opened.

- [Ramp]: A ramp that attaches to the end of a corridor to allow kerbals to get in and out, and even very little rovers (think: Sojourner-like, I don't want to hear complains like: "My Curiosity-rover tried to get inside the corridor and broke everything")! Warning: They tend to get slippery under low gravity. Although, it shouldn't hurt the Kerbals, since it's low gravity.

- [stairs]: Static beautiful and unsafe stairs to climb into a module. They attach to the bottom node, and can be undocked to allow expansion of a base. They can NOT be used after. Warning: Due to Kerbals not knowing our to climb stairs, we use a force field that tends to get slippery under normal gravity, make sure your kerbals don't stand still on the stairs, or they will likely slip.

- [Jumpod]: A pod. Yes, you heard me right! A pod that allows for one kerbal to get inside, and take the control of your base. Equipped with IDN. Although, since it attaches to the END of a corridor, I hope nobody will use this function, since it implies that there's a Kerbal stranded with his pod, alone.

- [Engine Room]: Take a corridor, put fuel in its walls until it inflates, then strap some engines under it. Inefficient when used in normal conditions, useful when landing. It has a large gimbal range to allow for more asymetrical design, but don't go wild, laws of physics still apply.

AND because this is the funny feature of this mod... All parts (except the round side of the 2.5m adaptor, obviously) are equipped with this brand new technology: "Integrated Docking Nodes".

What is IDN?

- IDN designs the presence of hidden docking nodes at strategic points in our modular modules. (No, it's absolutely not a tautology) Which means you can dock dynamicaly all the modules. And there's no worry to have about how will the connection go between two modules ("What if my second corridor is rotated at 90Ã‚Â°?") Well, it's technically impossible for two modules to dock at an angle between then, except at 180Ã‚Â°, which means that one of the two modules is upside-down... And in this case, it's your fault. And to avoid this last problem, the name of the mod is written on the side of the corridor.

What does it look like?

Like this:

Warnings and Recommendations:

- This mod is in discontinued development, but it should be fine. I didn't see any major bugs, expect none, report the few you'll find

- We're not responsible for any damage it could do to your game, it's supposed not to, and many people ( I ) can run it fine (This is only here as a filler, in fact.)

- Most parts are correctly rotated in the SPH, in the VAB, you just have to press S to have them right. (Very important for the four-ways node.)

- Launching a base with this mod into space can be tricky, Landing it even more. For landing, your best bet is parachutes and/or engines.

What's coming next?

Probably something, but not soon.

Where do I download it?

Kerbal Stuff Link!

Edited November 16, 2014 by Ravski
Updating, a year after.
This looks pretty awesome

Can you add transparent-blueish windows to corridor module together with door/airlocks? It would be a bit silly to meticulously lock airlock, and then go for a merry walk through corridor wide open to space.

Can you add transparent-blueish windows to corridor module together with door/airlocks? It would be a bit silly to meticulously lock airlock, and then go for a merry walk through corridor wide open to space.

It will likely be done. Either this update or the next one

Edited May 9, 2013 by Ravski
Welcome back! mmm is bee's knees At whaat times are you or your team online? I live in sweden haha ;P But the commandmodule is pretty done =) if you havnt tried this basepack its a must cheers

Welcome back! mmm is bee's knees At whaat times are you or your team online? I live in sweden haha ;P But the commandmodule is pretty done =) if you havnt tried this basepack its a must cheers

Well, we both are located in Europe, so it won't be a problem.

And I'm online pretty much all day long, if not, between 5p.m and 10p.m

Also, I saw the command module. We plan to make our pod the same way, if we manage it

Edited May 9, 2013 by Ravski
Or you could have mine I wouldnt mind giving it to your, it need some better shinier texture though haha but i can draw something up cheers Ah okey i see=)
Well, the research department about the pod (AKA Me) has made major breakthrough. Expect a pod in the next update
Aah great to see this back on the forums. Looking forward to the next update.
Early Prototype...
Fits the style of the mod ,slick and homeworld-ish Nice work as usuall
I am having a ton of trouble just trying to get things to connect with each other. They always want to connect to one side.

I took so long of a time designing a hull for my interplanetary cruiser and you just had to go make it look non-idiotic! Jeez.

Looking forward to the door update!

We've made really big progress in the next update.

Although... I have to ask, we've got two way of animating door:

- The stock one, which allows for control as any part of a normal ship (except solar panels).

- The Vanguard Plugin one, which allows for a kerbal outside to open them in EVA. Although, it does require the Vanguard Plugin.

Which one would you prefer to see implemented? It wouldn't be a problem to allow them both to be downloaded, also.
I would recommend the Vanguard as most people will just keep asking for EVA control.
That's right... We'll probably make the Vanguard one the official one, and the stock one an alternative download. Time will tell
Locs wery cool
i want more can we get more

i want more can we get more

ask and you shall receive,
Ohh, this will make for a very cool planetary base. Have you guys considered adding domes? Like a inflatable 'igloo' habitats, or glass domes acting as greenhouses?

Ohh, this will make for a very cool planetary base. Have you guys considered adding domes? Like a inflatable 'igloo' habitats, or glass domes acting as greenhouses?

i can neither confirm nor deny these accusations, all i will say is that the next few updates will be very interesting

Damn. then me asking about command center style pods wouldn't get a answer...?

Also, too bad there is no way to simulate gravity in pieces for usage in open space... Otherwise I'd gleefully deorbit my space stations and replace them with stations made of these pieces....

Edited May 22, 2013 by Lazurkri

Damn. then me asking about command center style pods wouldn't get a answer...?

I've got some things in the initial planning stage for something like this, definatly won't be in the next update tho

Ah. I had another idea; a smallish "Hanger" with a door in the side ( for spaceplanes to roll into when the hanger is in a gravity field) and one in the roof (to be used for planes, drones, missiles, and other stuff in zero grav conditions). After all, be fun to be able to do maintenance on your planes in a shirtsleeves environment, no?

Edited May 23, 2013 by Lazurkri
This mod has great potential! Good job!
